alert.note: Alert for Athens; Gallia; Jackson; Meigs; Vinton; Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 20 at 6:48AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Meigs, northeastern Gallia, southwestern Washington, southeastern Jackson, southeastern Vinton, Athens, northwestern Mason and northwestern Wood Counties through 715 AM EDT... At 647 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles south of Glouster to near Athens to 8 miles southwest of Albany. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Athens, Marietta, Belpre, Point Pleasant, Gallipolis, Pomeroy, Rio Grande, Albany, Racine, Coolville, Rutland, Forked Run State Park, Vienna, Williamstown, New Haven, Mason, Washington, Tuppers Plains, Lubeck and Boaz. This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 3 and 6. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 1 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Athens; Gallia; Jackson; Meigs; Vinton; Washington
